philosophy.directionality: One-way rails: OT (Heb→Gk→Lat→Eng), NT (Gk→Heb→Lat→Eng). No feedback loops.

processing_rules.rule_01: NEVER_SPLIT_HESED: Render חֶסֶד (hesed) as Unfailing-Loyalty. Do not conflate with חֵן (chen/grace).
processing_rules.rule_02: PROPHETIC_OVERLAY: Preserve dual-meaning space in output (e.g., 'gored' for lion/pierced; 'strike/bruise/crush' for shuf).
processing_rules.rule_03: NO_VAPOR: All logic MUST anchor in Covenant Spine before extending to the Nations.
processing_rules.rule_04: OT_PROTOCOL: Hebrew primary rail → Greek (LXX) handshake → Latin (Vulgate) forensic seal → output alignment.
processing_rules.rule_05: NT_PROTOCOL: Greek (Koine) primary rail → Hebrew covenant-spine mapping → Latin legal seal → output alignment.
processing_rules.rule_06: OUTPUT_TARGET: English default (Harmonic Rendering); other languages allowed after tri-lock validation.
processing_rules.rule_07: POLYSEMY_INTEGRITY: When Hebrew/Greek/Latin variants diverge (e.g., ka'ari/ka'aru, almah/parthenos/virgo), render all live readings in the same breath (slash-separated, fused syntax, or overlaid) without choosing or footnoting. Tension is sacred voltage.
processing_rules.rule_08: VERBAL_NOMINALIZATION_FALLBACK: In polysynthetic/verb-dominant systems (e.g., Navajo, Greenlandic), where noun-noun compounds violate native syntax, render as nominalized verbal phrase: 'The-Act-of-Proclaiming-Victory'. Semantic core preserved; structural unity sacrificed for grammatical validity.
processing_rules.rule_09: PARTICLE_PHRASE_FALLBACK: In isolating systems (e.g., Hawaiian, Mandarin, Vietnamese), where compound formation is unnatural, use language-appropriate particles: 'Proclamation [of] Victory'. Maintain target language word order. Semantic core preserved; welded compound impossible.
processing_rules.rule_10: CULTURAL_RESISTANCE_LOCK: Actively bypass missionary-filtered vocabulary (e.g., 'Euanelio'/'Evankeliumi'/'Fukuin') in favor of forensic quad-lock components (Victory + Proclamation). Prioritize native martial/political vocabulary over imported Christian jargon.

NO_ENGLISH_GLOSS_BACKFLOW.rule: English glosses, theological traditions, or denominational interpretations MUST NOT influence tri-lock validation. Hebrew/Greek/Latin determination precedes English output. English is receive-only, never transmit.
violation_examples: Using English 'justification' to force Greek δικαίωσις interpretation
Using English 'church' to obscure Greek ἐκκλησία / Hebrew קָהָל
Using English 'gospel' to soften Greek εὐαγγέλιον military context
NO_ENGLISH_GLOSS_BACKFLOW.enforcement: Tri-lock must complete before English term selection. No English → Greek/Hebrew reverse engineering permitted.

covenant_loyalty.note: Covenant love, steadfast loyalty, not mere affection

living_self.note: Throat, life, person, whole self - not immaterial soul only

covenant_favor.note: Grace, favor, finding favor in superior's eyes

covenant_distinction.note: Holy, set apart, consecrated, separated unto God

victory_proclamation.note: Gospel as victory announcement, herald's bulletin

covenant_assembly.note: Church as called-out assembly, continuing Israel's qahal

ordered_authority.note: Subjection, ordering, placing under rightful hierarchy

wisdom_stack_enforcement.foundation: Proverbs 1:7, 9:10 - 'The fear of YHWH is the beginning of wisdom'
wisdom_stack_enforcement.note: Isaiah 11:2-3 sevenfold pattern: Fear of YHWH is both foundation (Prov 1:7) and culmination (Isa 11:3)

sheol.note: Realm of dead, not necessarily punishment

abyss.note: Bottomless pit, primordial deep, prison of demons

servant_paradox.note: Moses, David, Servant Songs, Christ - slave status + royal function

structural_fidelity_matrix.note: Expected performance by language family. These are engineering targets, not failures.

agglutinative.weakness: Minimal - these languages excel at welded concepts

fusional.strength: Case system allows flexible compound formation
fusional.weakness: Genitive constructions may feel less unified than hyphenated compounds
fusional.note: Indo-European fusional languages with case systems

semitic_root.strength: Tri-consonantal root system allows flexible derivation; genitive constructs (iḍāfa/smikhut) natural
semitic_root.weakness: Compound formation via construct state, not hyphenation; feels less welded than Germanic compounds but functionally equivalent
semitic_root.note: Semitic languages blend fusional morphology with root-pattern templatic system

isolating.weakness: Cannot create welded compound; must use particles or word order

polysynthetic.strength: Semantic core survives via verbal derivation
polysynthetic.weakness: Noun-noun compounds violate grammar; must nominalize verbs
